website_summaries.verdict: This durable weight tree not only holds up to 1,000 lbs. of weights, but it can also hold two Olympic bars.
pros: Olympic weight tree/bar rack with six 2" x 8" storage posts
Central weight-loaded system virtually eliminates tipping
Measures 23"W  x 40" H x 20"D. Made of high tensile strength steel
cons: If you find the rack wobbles, tighten it with an Allen wrench from your tool set instead of the included one
And be sure that you didn't put a washer on the bottom center peg

customer_reviews.title: the rack is sturdy, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I had a larger rackbput I wanted something that takes up a little less space. This rack accomplishes that. Numerous reviewers mention the racks ability to accommodate the weight plates. I used the two bottom pins for 45 & 25 lbs. plates. If you put a 25 lbs on the second pin, the only plate that will fit above are 2.5 lbs, but for me this did not present any real issue. I gave the rack 4 stars because it could have been designed a little taller with little effort. That said, the rack is sturdy, easy to assemble. Happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Ty Van Slooten

customer_reviews.title: For the price it functions really well.
customer_reviews.text: Cross-bar metal is wimpy, aka if you have an over-enthusiastic husband tightening the bolts to hold the bars in place the upright will easily cut into them. caught him before he cut completely through. For the price it functions really well. LOVE the bar holders! Would have been 5 stars if the cross bars were a better metal.
customer_reviews.author: Madi R.

customer_reviews.title: Holds my Weights!
customer_reviews.text: Holds all my weights! I have 3 45's on each side of the bottom pegs, 2 25's on the middle left peg, 4 10's on the middle right peg, 2 2.5's on the peg above the 25's and 4 5's on the peg above the 10's. It also holds both of my bars nicely. Definitely recommend for those looking for a good weight tree.
customer_reviews.author: Cb325

customer_reviews.title: Buy your own bolts
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid built weight stand. The problem is that the bolts included with it are about 1/2 inch longer than they should be. Once tightened down they stick out the width of a finger and are are a hazard. I called the company and they stated to me that those were the bolts I was going to get and if I wanted bolts that fit I would have to go to the hardware store and buy different bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Very solid, works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Easily holds all of my 45, 25, 10, 5, 2.5 plates and two bars. You won't be able to fit anything on the top if you put 35s in the center, so if you have 35 lb plates they will have to go on the bottom bar. Assembly was easy, took about 5 minutes. I will most likely buy another one of these to have one on each side of my power rack. Only gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because I can't fit the 35s on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So happy to have this!
customer_reviews.text: Would give this 5 stars, but I can't get the cross-bars to keep from shifting. Not a huge deal, but cost my rating a star. Other than that, it's sturdy and so much better than having my plates on the floor. Also love the two bar holders. Makes for a much neater home gym!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Anne Martin

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy unit that does its job well
customer_reviews.text: No more weights on the floor! Nice sturdy unit that does its job well. Well finished and very easy to put together. Base is wide enough to support 45's on the top rung without tipping over or being unsteady for those who don't like to reach down to the lowers for heavier weights.
customer_reviews.author: Charles   Beck

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy rack to hold my weights. Glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Evelin Eleven

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tree along with the Body Solid colored olympic rubber plates. There is not enough space between the rows of posts and the weights overlap each other (actually most of them are ok but the 2 1/2 plates overlap the 25s below them. If you are getting the rubberized grip plates, you need model number WT46 according to customer service. I ordered that one and will send this one back. Otherwise its likely made and quite sturdy
customer_reviews.author: David Solinsky

customer_reviews.title: It works but the design isn't very thought out. ...
customer_reviews.text: It works but the design isn't very thought out. You have to stagger the weights to fit them. The middle bars should have been lowered an inch and a half.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. I still have it
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. I still have it. It's actually right next to me holding... 5x 45lb plates, 11x 25lb plates, 6x 10lb plates, 2x 5lb plates, and 4x 2.5lb plates, and there's still a lot of room up at the top. Oh, it's also holding two barbells.
customer_reviews.author: Monsieur Peeps

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit its own weights. Different model needed
customer_reviews.text: Body Solid sells an Olympic weight tree that doesn't fit their weights. It shows in the picture their weights but yet the is not enough room for the different sizes. I would retirn but to late. I didn't try weights on them until a few weeks ago. I saw a review that customer service told a guy there was a special tree that fits the weight but seems false advertisement in the picture. Unit is solid just disappointed that it won't fit the weights I purchased for it.
customer_reviews.author: John Benson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic deal. Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic deal. Easy to assemble, holds lots of weights and a couple of bars. If only it were a tiny bit taller to allow for stacking three rows of bumper plates...:)
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers state, it's a bit awkward trying to try and make plates of every size fit onto this. I ordered it as a secondary storage, so that's not much of an issue for me. The steel and plastic seem good enough to last the daily workouts, and the design is intuitive enough that you don't really need the directions to put it together. You'll need one wrench to tighten everything after intital setup. Also, I'm not really sure why there are holes machined into one side of the weight bars. I can only assume they were meant to be in the middle, as there are bolts that hold them in place on the stand.
customer_reviews.author: WC Student

customer_reviews.title: Held our weights perfectly. Black bars do get a ...
customer_reviews.text: Held our weights perfectly. Black bars do get a little scuffed, but what wouldn't with weights sliding on and off them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. A very minute problem is the bolts that ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. A very minute problem is the bolts that have to keep the plate bars in place. As others reviewers have put, should be pre drilled. But really doesn't make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: what

customer_reviews.title: Good investment!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made! Easy to assemble, took only 20 minutes. Good advice from a previous review to use a rubber mallet. I ended using a small piece of a 2x4 block, between my hammer, and the plastic end caps. Double barbell holders, a huge plus...Worth every penny that I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Apex Training

customer_reviews.title: D-
customer_reviews.text: Mine wont stand flat on all 4 legs tried everything and nothing returning.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together, im glad i got it.
customer_reviews.author: MISOLIS

customer_reviews.title: Returned.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item - base was not at all level despite multiple attempts to change the the posts and floor mounts.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy...doesn't play well with body-solid weights
customer_reviews.text: This weight tree is sturdy and easy to assemble. My only complaint is that body-solids own sub-45 lbs plates don't really fit on the tree very well as they are larger diameter than standard plates of the same weight. Standard plates fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Organized Product
customer_reviews.text: It arrived early and some of my weights fit on there as well as the Olympic bars. I got more weights coming soon and I look forward to stacking them on there.
customer_reviews.author: Hannibal

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Its a quality product, simple to assemble, very stable, looks great and keeps my plates organized. I would recommend this to anyone that has a decent home gym. Also I love the fact that it can hold both my easy curl bar and my Olympic bench bar. Really keeps the clutter away. And it's relatively inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent weight tree
customer_reviews.text: Excellent weight tree! Came packaged very well and had everything for the minor assembly in the box. Even came with two bottles of touch up paint in case you are worried about scratches. Very solid, I hooked a land mine/t-bar row mount to mine and it holds well.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph H.

customer_reviews.title: Great weight tree!
customer_reviews.text: Good looking, sturdy, all my olympic weights fit there. The distance between the racks is good for me, but be careful! I store 45s on my squat cage racks. In my setup the lowest level is for 25s and 35s. If I put 25s on the 2nd "level", then I won't be able to put my 10s or 5s right above them on the 3rd level, since they'll touch each other. 2.5s will fit though. Note also this is an olympic weight tree and not a standard weight tree.
customer_reviews.author: FireFox

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: stand came together and holds all my plates safely/securely .. looks very professional now. in my workout room.
customer_reviews.author: Erik M Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: If you're in need of a weight tree to help organize your gym, this rack is worth the price I had no trouble stacking the tree with all the standard size weight disks. It looks great on the floor and it's easy to assemble. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas (Sherri's husband)

customer_reviews.title: Good to Go
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Product is as advertised. Arrived in a timely manner. Good to go.
customer_reviews.author: JohnD

customer_reviews.title: Good tree holder but bolts are difficult to tighten
customer_reviews.text: Good tree holder but instructions are not simple and bolts are not easy to tighten. Holds my 300lb Olympic size weights.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Good design.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good strong rack for home use, I have one problem, on one of the legs in the rack that I purchased, the plastic fitting for the end was facing the wrong direction. I ended up cutting it to fit it in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spacing too crowded to fit weights.
customer_reviews.text: Good value, but my weights don't all fit as the spacing is too crowded between the racks. Should have been designed with this in mind...
customer_reviews.author: Eric G

customer_reviews.title: One inch short of being 5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: The top bars will not fit even the 2.5lb weight plates with 25lb plates on the middle bar. Otherwise it is very solid and well built. The manufacturer needs to increase the space between the top two bars to accomated rubber coated weight plates.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Spear

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: Solid stand.. use it to store couple hundred pounds of weights and two bars.
customer_reviews.author: JKA

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Item was straight forward and easy to assemble. Appears to be well constructed and heavy duty enough for home use. Included some touch up paint as well. we use rubber coated weights and they fit ok.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole M.

customer_reviews.title: Just right!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Very sturdy.holds olympic bar and curl bar. Love it.nothing wrong...everything just right.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Harris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Husband loved this to go along with his body solid power rack.
customer_reviews.author: Angelic

customer_reviews.title: Husband Loves
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for Christmas for all of his weights....it was easy to assemble and is sturdy enough to hold all of our olympic-sized weights. Good product!
customer_reviews.author: runQrun

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and solidly built
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and solidly built. Helps organize my weights and bars in the limited space in my home gym in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Boomer

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I really like the weight tree. I have had no issues with it and all my plates fit (I'm not sure why some people had issues with spacing).
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Digby Sellers

customer_reviews.title: Another winner
customer_reviews.text: Everything Body Solid puts out is good. Put all the weights on one side and it still won't even lean. Impressed
customer_reviews.author: Moe

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly and feels pretty solid
customer_reviews.text: The price is right so I was a little concerned it would feel flimsy but not at all. This rack is strong and feels solid. Easily hold the 300 lbs we put on it plus the bar
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I do not like how the pegs slide in and out unless completely wrenched down.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Lara

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality for price.
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, well packed and arrived on time. Great addition to the home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Pellicciaro

customer_reviews.title: Free Weight Organizer.
customer_reviews.text: The unit is made well. It does have some movement in it. The price is a touch high in my opinion; however, not so much that it is a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, but directions are horrible.
customer_reviews.text: The rack holds my son's 300 lb olympic weights beautifully, but the poorly documented directions made it much more difficult to assemble than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: M. Mitnick

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely happy with this tree
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased this tree not expecting it to be nearly as solid as it is, because of of the lower price compared to similar units. I am extremely happy with this tree, for a compact unit, which can easily hold 300 lbs. and more I consider it,a great buy. Thanks Body Solid, Good job... very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Cal Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I read complaints that the TOP 2 bars wouldn't fit weights properly. Took a chance. No problems for me. 2.5s, 5's, 10s & 25s all fit, with the bottom bar holding my 35s and 45s. So satisfied that I wanted to review this so someone else on the fence wouldn't be deterred. YOUR weights might not fit, based on what others wrote. MINE did...
customer_reviews.author: aa

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Holds lots of weight. Well spaced. Wish the lower bars were a bit longer to get another 45 or two on it. DO NOT attempt to move/slide this with weight on it though.
customer_reviews.author: 04CE

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: It works great!! It was easy to assemble. It's very sturdy. It even comes with touch up paint. I suggest this to everybody with a home gym or if you plan on having a home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best weight storage unit you will find that also stores bars.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew F.

customer_reviews.title: Good solid design
customer_reviews.text: Good solid design. Easy to put together. The only complaint I have is the instructions are wrong relating to the size of wrenches that you need.
customer_reviews.author: David Marlar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good. Weights go on great and it takes up way less space than I thought it would.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bacus

customer_reviews.title: Serves my needs well, may order another
customer_reviews.text: Having eighteen (18) 45 pound plates, plus loads of 25s and on down, this keeps my garage gym very neat and organized. It holds 16 of said 45 pounders with no issue at all - I did not install the middle bar, as I only intended to house the 45s and needed the space. It's easy to assemble and very sturdy, and well worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: A. White

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: This is well-made and easy to get the plates on & off. These are the eight or more words added as required by this idiotic system.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Colvin

customer_reviews.title: Quality Weight Tree
customer_reviews.text: This is a great weight tree for anyone with Olympic sized plates. It doesn't take up much floor space, and it's very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for holding a lot of weight in a small space.
customer_reviews.author: Ben and Betsey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very solid works great for saving space in gym awesome product will be purchasing another soon
customer_reviews.author: Tanner S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Not bad the screws are sticking out but still works for me.
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoYo

customer_reviews.title: Excellant Piece Of Equipment!!!
customer_reviews.text: This piece of equipment is built for life, incredibly strong, sturdy, and honesly the easiest thing that I have ever put together in my life. It literaly took me like 15 minutes, and it was completly done. Only takes one person to put together, and can be done by anyone. Also arrived very fast, excellant delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Todd Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Good weight holder
customer_reviews.text: The olympic plate holder is excellent. I have around 300 lb on it and it doesnt even wobble. I would recommend this product if you are looking for something tough and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar

customer_reviews.title: Olmpic weight tree
customer_reviews.text: Product works great. Well built with an attractive finish. Arrived quickly and at the cheapest price around. The only concern I have is the plate "spacing" (vertically) is tight. Depending on what brand plates you use they may or may not fit diameter wise next to the other plates on the other peg. My set includes 45 and 25lb plates and if you put them on adjoining pegs they barely make it. Perhaps another brand would be more spacious so to speak, but I only have one brand to compare too. Overall very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: M. LoSchiavo

customer_reviews.title: It Works..  Quality is eh.
customer_reviews.text: I was not really impressed putting this thing together. A bolt smashes up against the weight bars to keep them from moving. The way the 2 legs attach leaves them able to angle slightly once the weights are loaded. Paint scratches off the bars when you load weights. Does it hold the weights? Yes. Does it hold 2 bars? Yes. If that's all you need, it's great. If you want something that has that quality feel to it, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Great weight tree
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality weight tree. Very sturdy and very balanced. It was a piece of cake to assemble. Body-Solid makes good products
customer_reviews.author: Domiano

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my set up. Takes up minimal space. Seems like it should last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Just Us

customer_reviews.title: Design defect
customer_reviews.text: The holes on the poles that hold the weights are drilled at the edge instead of the middle. Called the manufacturer and was told that the holes are suppose to be at the edge and the bolts to hold the poles are suppose to stick out and not have any holes to go into. In my opinion I think they are lying and selling a defective product and should list the product as having a design defect.
customer_reviews.author: Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I went with the Body Solid bar holder with a two bar holder capacity. I can store not only my weights; but my gloves, resistance bands, and bar collars. I would recommend this product to anyone looking to store their weights and more.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This product looks as shown, was easy to assemble and fits all of my oly weight plates with no issues. I may even buy a 2nd set of plates since I know the tree can handle them!
customer_reviews.author: Angela A. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: it holds plates as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It is an easy set up, connect everything and tighten nuts and bolts. It comes with plastic end caps that you can hit on with the palm of your hand with moderate force. The plates fit on with ease with no over lapping.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: The screw and bolt are made to hold the bars via pressure instead of screwing the screw and bolt all the way through the bar. This allows the bar to slide if heavy wait is slid onto the bars. Poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Cole

customer_reviews.title: ... and both are very solid and make accessing weights easy. Ten minutes to put together
customer_reviews.text: I have the body solid for olympic plates and dumbbells and both are very solid and make accessing weights easy. Ten minutes to put together.
customer_reviews.author: eric jones

customer_reviews.title: other than that I am very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Showed up with an end cap broken during shipping or handling, other than that I am very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Pike on the Fly

customer_reviews.title: great weight tree
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it will be tough to find a better weight tree. There is a little assembly required, but not very much (maybe 1/2 hour or so) and very easy to do. Very solid, holds plenty of weight and two Olympic bars, and doesn't take up a lot of floor space either.
customer_reviews.author: ngr

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bad spacing! Can't fit 45's on the bottom with 25s above it! Someone didn't think through this design
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: I love this weight tree!
customer_reviews.text: Holds as much weight as you cab fit. Makes ihr home gym look like a real gym!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: As promised solid built and good spacing to support various size weights
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was straightforward. I do not like how the cross bars are anchored. No hole for the screw to anchor. The screw just presses against the bar. Also 10lb weights do not fit on the top tier without hitting the weights on the middle tier unless I move the 25lb weights to the bottom tier with the 45lb weights
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Great plate/bar holder
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well made, looks nice, reasonably priced. Not much not to like. My only complaint is that the plate holder tubes themselves are not marked or fixed into position in any way except for with a tension screw. Kind of annoying to try and get everything even because of this, but once it's together, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hill

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Average tree some scratches on the tree when I unpacked it
customer_reviews.author: Wayne jones

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item..should have gotten one long ago..Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Hill

customer_reviews.title: pretty solid piece that will definitely last a long time
customer_reviews.text: it is what I expected . pretty solid piece that will definitely last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: d rod

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble. Sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Not the cheapest, but great! holds all my plates and bars over 250 lbs worth. Super easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Ngo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly, easy to put together, and is well built.
customer_reviews.author: KC Sunshine MO

customer_reviews.title: Super strong plate tree
customer_reviews.text: This Body Solid plate tree is a beast and the strongest tree I have seen in a home gym. I am just glad it is in mine because it is very safe and sturdy. Doesn't wobble at all or feel cheap. It will hold ALL your plates no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua G

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. I put it together and it holds all my plates and my bars but its crooked and rocks a little bit. Also when you put the beans through there are no holes for the screws to go into because the holes that are drilled in the beams are at the very end of the beam instead of the middle where they should be. I'm not real impressed by this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

product_meta.title: Body-Solid Olympic Plate Tree Bar Holder (GOWT)
product_meta.description:
Outfit your gym with the Body-Solid Olympic Plate Tree Bar Holder (GOWT) to organize your gym to safely workout. Keep your weights off the ground for easy storage and removal. The ultra-tough electrostatically applied powder coated finish plate tree and bar holder offers the highest degree of durability. Two Olympic bar holders stores all styles of Olympic bars and the central weight distribution eliminates the risk of tipping. Ideal for home or commercial use. Weights and bars sold separately.

AMAZON.COM
Keep your workout area safe, clean, and organized with the Body Solid GOWT Olympic weight tree and bar rack. Outfitted with six 2-by-8-inch weight storage posts, the rack can hold up to 1,000 pounds of weight in several configurations, including a series of 45-, 35-, 25-, 10-, 5-, and 2.5-pound weights. More importantly, the storage posts keep the plates safely suspended off the floor for easy storage and removal--just slip on the weights after you're done and you'll keep your workout room uncluttered. The rack also offers space to store a pair of Olympic bar holders, and includes a central weight-load distribution system that virtually eliminates the risk of tipping. Made of high-tensile-strength steel with all-four-side welded construction and finished with ultra-tough, electrostatically applied powder coat finish, the GOWT measures 23 by 40 by 20 inches (W x H x D) and carries a lifetime warranty. The weight plates and bars are sold separately.
feature_bullets: FUNCTIONALITY: Central weight distribution eliminates the risk of tipping while keeping plates and bars off the ground for safe workouts and easy use
DESIGN: Welded steel construction offers high tensile strength and durability for years to come
MEASUREMENT: 20 x 23 x 40 inches (L x W x H) and weighs 31 lbs
WARRANTY: In-home manufacturer’s lifetime warranty and commercial rated
